name: Mbielu
description: The Mbielu is a huge beast known for its exceptional physical power, possessing toxic skin and a tail attack. Its appearances exude strength, and it has a notable bellow that can incapacitate foes.
memorable: Its toxic skin can poison those who get too close, and its bellow can disorient nearby creatures.
goals: To protect its territory and defend itself from threats.
relations: Could be encountered with other large beasts or in water-related ecosystems.
environment: Typically found in aquatic or marshy environments.
strengths: High physical strength and durability make it a potent threat in melee combat.
weaknesses: Very low intelligence and charisma can limit its ability to interact with other creatures.
attacks: Utilizes a melee tail attack that deals bludgeoning and poison damage, and can knock opponents prone.
most_powerful_ability: Rumbling Bellow, which causes thunder damage and may incapacitate poisoned foes.
senses: Has passive perception of 13, allowing it to sense nearby creatures effectively.
skills: Proficient in Perception, giving it enhanced awareness of its surroundings.
additional_information: Can hold its breath for 30 minutes, making it adaptable in aquatic settings.
Resilient to poison damage and incapable of being poisoned.
Toxic Skin poses a deterrent to melee attackers, causing them to potentially be poisoned.
The creature has an excellent melee reach with its tail attack.
Can inflict disadvantage on saving throws due to hallucinations if poisoned.
test_queries: animal that can incapacitate with sound
strong aquatic creature with a poisonous attack
melee monster with a tail and thunder roar
creature that excels in close-range combat
